title: How to Clean Your Shaker

steps.headline: As soon as you've finished your shake, immediately rinse it with warm water.
Scrub the shaker out with soapy water and a scoured.
steps.description: You really need to get all of the bits out - protein powder turns rock hard if left to dry out on the inside of your shaker.

steps.headline: Leave your shaker upside on a drying rack, or, dry thoroughly with a towel.
steps.description: Never let your shaker sit in the cupboard wet - you'll immediately regret it soon as you go to make your next shake

steps.headline: Appreciate the fact that cleaning it now means you don't have to clean it later!

methods.name: Revive a shaker that hasn't been washed for days

steps.headline: Have an initial rinse with warm water to get the left over liquid out.
steps.description: The shaker will most likely be filled with curdled milk and dried protein.

steps.headline: Boil the kettle.
steps.description: Add some washing up liquid to the shaker. Fill the shaker with boiling water and leave to stand for 5 minutes. This will loosen up all the dried content that is stuck to the sides

steps.headline: Carefully pour out the water and scrub with a scourer/sponge and soapy water as usual.
Leave your shaker upside on a drying rack, or, dry thoroughly with a towel.
steps.description: Never let your shaker sit in the cupboard wet - you'll immediately regret it soon as you go to make your next shake

steps.headline: Learn to wash your shaker as soon as you've used it to prevent this from happening again!
